results.title: House in summer magic lantern slide
results.brief_description: Magic lantern slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a English style house and gardens. Several pencil marking on the wood. On the underside, ‘57’ has been written in a thick white ink.

results.title: Magic lantern three-panel slipping slide (Flower Bloom)
results.brief_description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a flower bud blooming. Two adjustable sliding pieces of glass - slide left and right to show the flower blooming. Set against a black background. Made by W.F. Archer, Liverpool, 43 Lord St and 63 South Castle St. ‘49’ and ‘R’ written in pencil on wooden frame.
results.description: Magic lantern set effects slide with wooden frame. The coloured slide shows a flower bud blooming. results.title: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit glass slides (Reptiles)
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Donated by William Kerr on behalf of Edwin Schefferle.
results.brief_description: There are three parts to the Reptiles slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. These slides form part of The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit with removable chimney and internal wooden block. The lantern is housed in original box with metal handle, and internal red and blue graphic for: The Empire Magic Lantern Outfit. 20 glass slides in custom box, length of textile to keep box shut, 2 small empty boxes which act to store slides in a snug manner.
results.description: There are three parts to the Reptiles slides, each slide has 4 images. These small slides have red sealing tape around the edges. results.title: Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 - Red
results.brief_description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red was broadcast as the first of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Space Between the Gaps (Paul Gafney), abcTVxyz (Dale Nason), The Visitor (Andrew Till) and Third Eye (Ollie Olsen).

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.
results.description:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red was broadcast as the first of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.

CREDITS:

STUDIO CREW
Director - Adem Jaffers
Technical Producer - Steve Middleton, CSG Staff
Graphics Operators - Lee Bristow, Dan Flett, Daniel Alisauskas
Tape Operator - Michael Lyons
Directors Assistant - Jacinta Hicken
Audio Engineer - Des Amos
Disc Jockey - The Visitor

PRODUCTION CREW
Producers - Adem Jaffers, Frank Peppard
Web Stuff - Gary Gallagher
Sponsorship - Catherine Carr
Publicity - Sunny Grace
Spectrum Fact-book Design - Melanie Carr
Spectrum + Neolithic Keeper Animation - Adem Jaffers
Music - Ollie Olsen, Brian St James, Danny Woodman

CONTRIBUTORS
22:32:00hrs
VJ - Jeff Jaffers, Kimberly Hughes
DJ - Ollie Olsen

23:17:30hrs
RAVE SAFE
Director - Jeff Jaffers
Animation - Adem Jaffers
Music - Ollie Olsen

23:20:35hrs
abcTVxyz
Dale Nason
DJ - The Visitor

23:21:00hrs
RRRealtime
VJ - Mandala
DJ - The Visitor
description_for_label:
Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red was broadcast as the first of eight in an episodic series on Channel 31 in Melbourne. This format allowed for the creation of tighter, curated segments for broadcast instead of the impromptu, marathon-like events of the previous Cyberthons.

As well as electronic music, art, remixed footage (from previous Cyberthon events), guerrilla style music videos, drug and rave safe promotions, experimental performances and short films, global participation was also encouraged via online production meetings. As Cyberthon curator Adem Jaffers said “Cyberthon had become a public TV ‘Access Show’ nested within a public TV ‘Access Channel’ [which was] quite unique really!”

A selection of artists: Tekno Mandala (Adem Jaffers), Space Between the Gaps (Paul Gafney), abcTVxyz (Dale Nason), The Visitor (Andrew Till) and Third Eye (Ollie Olsen).

Cyberthon V: Spectrum 1 Red is part of the Cyberthon Archive generously donated to ACMI by Adem Jaffers.
